definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: Now, Mr. Martin is on the 10 floor. The attendant comes to meet Mr. Matin.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁先生到了十樓，服務員走過來迎接他。

sentences.english: The bellboy will take your bags and show you to your room .
sentences.chinese: 服務員會幫您提行李，並帶您到您的房間去。

sentences.english: The waiter came out with a tray with five bowls of noodles on it.
sentences.chinese: 服務員端了一個盤子出來，上面有五碗麪。

sentences.english: I'll ask the dining-car attendant to come and you can tell him what you want.
sentences.chinese: 我把餐車服務員找來，您可以告訴他你要喫什麼。

sentences.english: He frequently to Wang Jing wage restaurant meals, and when the waiter asked her designated.
sentences.chinese: 他頻繁來王靜打工的餐館喫飯，並指定要她當服務員。

sentences.english: They're waiters, too. Yes or no?
sentences.chinese: 的朋友們也是男服務員嗎？

sentences.english: Tell the man behind the counter what you want.
sentences.chinese: 你要什麼就告知櫃檯後面的男服務員。

sentences.english: Oh, attendant, we still need small sake and thank.
sentences.chinese: 噢，服務員，我們還需要一壺小清酒，謝謝。

sentences.english: The waitress appeared, "Are you ready to order?""
sentences.chinese: 女服務員走了過來，“佝們準備好點菜了嗎？”

sentences.english: He ordered a large double scotch from the bar man.
sentences.chinese: 他向酒吧服務員要了大杯雙人份蘇格蘭威士卡。

sentences.english: The bar steward are accountable to the beverage manager .
sentences.chinese: 酒吧間服務員要對餐飲部經理負責。

sentences.english: Yes. Just tell the redcap you want a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 有，只要告訴服務員你要叫部出租車。

sentences.english: Ying falsely claim is the waiter here, then panic away.
sentences.chinese: 珠英謊稱自己是這裏的服務員，便驚慌的走開了。

sentences.english: Waiter, we want fish filets in hot chili oil.
sentences.chinese: 服務員，給我們來個水煮魚。

sentences.english: The waiter smiled as he wrote down our order.
sentences.chinese: 服務員微微一笑，他寫下了我們的秩序。

sentences.english: The waiter hands him the bill and the guest signs his name on it.
sentences.chinese: 服務員遞過賬單，客人在上面簽了名。

definition: variant of 伙計|伙计[huo3 ji5]
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
